00010 #include "jcom.parameter.h"             // everything we need is in here
00011 
00012 // Globals
00013 t_class         *param_class;           // Required: Global pointer for our class
00014 bool            g_pattr_valid;          // Did pattr init successfully?
00015         
00016 int param_list_compare(t_atom *x, long lengthx, t_atom *y, long lengthy);
00017 
00018 /************************************************************************************/
00019 // Class Definition
00020 
00021 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00022 {
00023         t_class         *c;
00024         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00025         long            offset;
00026         
00027         // Initialize Globals
00028         g_pattr_valid = false;
00029         jamoma_init();
00030 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00031         // TODO: move this into the framework [TAP]
00032         short           err = 0;
00033         err = ext_pattr_setup();
00034         if(err){
00035                 post("Jamoma: pattr integration is not available - could not init pattr-bundle");
00036                 g_pattr_valid = false;
00037         }
00038         else
00039                 g_pattr_valid = true;
00040 #endif
00041 
00042         // Define our class
00043         c = class_new(OBJECT_CLASS_NAME,(method)param_new, (method)param_free, 
00044                 (short)sizeof(t_param), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00045         offset = calcoffset(t_param, common);
00046         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00047 
00048         if(g_pattr_valid == true)
00049                 pattr_obex_init(c);                     // set up the pattr obex
00050                 
00051         // Make methods accessible for our class:
00052         // Note that we can't make the bang method directly accessible here (must go through another function)
00053         //      because the function pointer is in out struct, which hasn't been defined yet
00054         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dispatched,                            "dispatched",                                   A_GIMME,        0);
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_int,                                           "int",                                                  A_DEFLONG,      0);
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_float,                                         "float",                                                A_DEFFLOAT,     0);
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_list,                                          "list",                                                 A_GIMME,        0);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_symbol,                                        "anything",                                             A_GIMME,        0);
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setRampFunctionParameter,      "ramp/function/parameter",              A_GIMME,        0);
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getRampFunctionParameter,      "ramp/function/parameter/get",  A_GIMME,        0);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setRampDriveParameter,         "ramp/drive/parameter",                 A_GIMME,        0);
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getRampDriveParameter,         "ramp/drive/parameter/get",             A_GIMME,        0);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_ui_refresh,                            "ui/refresh",                                   0);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_inc,                                           "inc",                                                  A_GIMME,        0);
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dec,                                           "dec",                                                  A_GIMME,        0);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_inc,                                           "+",                                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00067         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dec,                                           "-",                                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dump,                                          "dump",                                                 0);
00069         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_bang,                                          "bang",                                                 0);
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_assist,                                        "assist",                                               A_CANT,         0); 
00071 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00072         if(g_pattr_valid == true){
00073                 // required to manually add because of our pattr-wrapping for parameters
00074                 class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getvalueof,                    "getvalueof",   A_CANT, 0);
00075                 class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setvalueof,                    "setvalueof",   A_CANT, 0);
00076                 class_addmethod(c, (method)pattr_obex_notify,                   "notify",               A_CANT, 0);     
00077         }
00078 #endif
00079 
00080         if(g_pattr_valid == true)
00081                 jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(c, attr, offset, false);        // don't define name attr
00082         else
00083                 jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(c, attr, offset, true);         // define a name attr
00084                 
00085         // ATTRIBUTE: ramp      
00086         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/drive", _sym_symbol,
00087                 (method)param_attr_setramp, (method)param_attr_getramp,
00088                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_ramp));
00089         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/function", _sym_symbol,
00090                 (method)param_attr_setrampfunction, (method)param_attr_getrampfunction,
00091                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_rampfunction));
00092 
00093         // ATTRIBUTE: type - options are msg_generic, msg_int, msg_float, msg_symbol, msg_toggle, msg_list, msg_none
00094         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "type", _sym_symbol,
00095                 (method)param_attr_settype, (method)param_attr_gettype,
00096                 calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_type));
00097         
00098         // ATTRIBUTE: ui/freeze - toggles a "frozen" ui outlet so that you can save cpu
00099         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ui/freeze", _sym_long,
00100                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getfreeze,
00101                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_ui_freeze));
00102         
00103         // ATTRIBUTE: slavemode - indicates that the instance is slave to another parameter/message
00104         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "slave", _sym_long,
00105                 (method)0, (method)0,
00106                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_slavemode));
00107 
00108         // ATTRIBUTE: stepsize - how much increment or decrement by
00109         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "stepsize", _sym_float32,
00110                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getstepsize,
00111                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_stepsize));
00112 
00113         // ATTRIBUTE: priority - used to determine order of parameter recall in a preset
00114         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "priority", _sym_long,
00115                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getpriority,
00116                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_priority));
00117 
00118         // ATTRIBUTE: value
00119         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "value", _sym_atom, LISTSIZE,
00120                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getvalue,
00121                 calcoffset(t_param, list_size), calcoffset(t_param, attr_value));
00122 
00123         // Finalize our class
00124         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00125         param_class = c;
00126         
00127         return 0;
00128 }
00129 
00130 
00131 /************************************************************************************/
00132 // Object Life
00133 #pragma mark -
00134 #pragma mark life cycle
00135 
00136 void *param_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00137 {
00138         short           i;
00139         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);
00140         t_param         *x = (t_param *)object_alloc(param_class);
00141         t_symbol        *name = _sym_nothing;
00142 
00143         if(attrstart && argv)
00144                 atom_arg_getsym(&name, 0, attrstart, argv);
00145         else
00146                 name = symbol_unique();
00147 
00148         if(x){
00149                 for(i=num_outlets; i > 0; i--)
00150                         x->outlets[i-1] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00151                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (t_object *)x->outlets[k_outlet_dumpout]);
00152                 
00153                 x->ui_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)param_ui_queuefn);
00154                 x->ramp_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)param_ramp_setup);
00155 
00156                 // set defaults...
00157                 x->attr_rampfunction = _sym_nothing;
00158                 x->attr_ramp = _sym_nothing;
00159                 x->ramper = NULL;
00160 
00161                 // defaulted to one long above, set list to be of size 1
00162                 x->list_size = 1;
00163                 for(i = 0; i < LISTSIZE; i++)   
00164                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_list[i], 0); // atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, 0);
00165                 x->name = name;
00166                 atom_setsym(&x->name_atom, name);
00167                 x->attr_ui_freeze = 0;
00168                 x->attr_slavemode = 0;
00169                 x->attr_stepsize = 1.0;
00170                 x->attr_priority = 0;                                           // default is no priority
00171                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;                // set function pointer to default
00172                 
00173 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00174                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_message);
00175 #else
00176                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_parameter);
00177 #endif
00178                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                       // handle attribute args
00179                 if(g_pattr_valid == true)
00180                         pattr_obex_setup(x, name);                              // set up out internal pattr instance
00181 
00182                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00183                 
00184                 // If no type was specified by the user we call the accessor here
00185                 // this is important because memory is configured - not just setting a default!
00186                 if(x->common.attr_type == NULL){
00187                         t_atom a;
00188                         atom_setsym(&a, ps_msg_generic);
00189                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, ps_type, 1, &a);
00190                 }
00191                 if(x->attr_ramp == _sym_nothing){
00192                         t_atom a;
00193                         atom_setsym(&a, ps_none);
00194                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, gensym("ramp/drive"), 1, &a);
00195                 }
00196         }
00197         return (x);                                                                             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00198 }
00199 
00200 
00201 void param_free(t_param *x)
00202 {       
00203         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free((t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)x);
00204         qelem_free(x->ui_qelem);
00205         qelem_free(x->ramp_qelem);
00206         if(x->ramper)
00207                 delete x->ramper;
00208 }

00210 
00211 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00212 /************************************************************************************/
00213 // Communication with PSTO (pattrstorage)
00214 #pragma mark -
00215 #pragma mark pattr support
00216 
00217 // FROM psto
00218 t_max_err param_setvalueof(t_param *x, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00219 {
00220         if(argc && argv) {
00221                 sysmem_copyptr(argv, &x->atom_list[0], sizeof(t_atom) * argc);
00222                 x->list_size = argc;
00223                 x->param_output(x);
00224         }       
00225         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00226 }
00227 
00228 // TO psto
00229 t_max_err param_getvalueof(t_param *x, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00230 {
00231         if(argc && argv){
00232                 if(*argc && *argv) {
00233                         // use passed in memory
00234                 } 
00235                 else { 
00236                         if(x->list_size > 1)
00237                                 *argv = (t_atom *)getbytes(sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00238                         else
00239                                 *argv = (t_atom *)getbytes(sizeof(t_atom));
00240                 }
00241                 
00242                 *argc = x->list_size > 1 ? x->list_size : 1;
00243                 sysmem_copyptr(&x->atom_list[0], *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * (*argc));
00244         }
00245         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00246 }
00247 
00248 #endif
00249 
00250 
00251 /************************************************************************************/
00252 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00253 #pragma mark -
00254 #pragma mark attribute accessors
00255 
00256 // ATTRIBUTE: TYPE
00257 // This is crucial because it sets function pointers for the optimized clipping, bang, and other functions
00258 t_max_err param_attr_settype(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00259 {
00260         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00261         x->common.attr_type = arg;
00262 
00263         if(arg == ps_msg_int){
00264                 x->param_output = &param_output_int;
00265         }
00266         else if(arg == ps_msg_float){
00267                 x->param_output = &param_output_float;
00268         }
00269         else if(arg == ps_msg_symbol){
00270                 x->param_output = &param_output_symbol;
00271         }
00272         else if(arg == ps_msg_toggle){
00273                 x->param_output = &param_output_int;
00274         }
00275         else if(arg == ps_msg_generic){
00276                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;
00277         } 
00278         else if(arg == ps_msg_list){
00279                 x->param_output = &param_output_list;
00280         }
00281 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00282         else if(arg == ps_msg_none){
00283                 x->param_output = &param_output_none;
00284         }
00285 #endif // JMOD_MESSAGE
00286         else{
00287 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00288                 error("Jamoma - invalid type specified for %s jcom.message in the %s module.", x->name->s_name, x->common.module_name->s_name);
00289 #else
00290                 error("Jamoma - invalid type specified for %s jcom.parameter in the %s module.", x->name->s_name, x->common.module_name->s_name);
00291 #endif
00292                 x->common.attr_type = ps_msg_generic;
00293                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;
00294         }
00295 
00296         qelem_set(x->ramp_qelem);       // set up the rampunit with callbacks appropriate to this data type
00297 
00298         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00299         #pragma unused(attr)
00300 }
00301 
00302 
00303 // ATTRIBUTE: RAMP
00304 // This is crucial because it sets function pointers
00305 t_max_err param_attr_setramp(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00306 {
00307         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00308         x->attr_ramp = arg;
00309         
00310         qelem_set(x->ramp_qelem);       // place a call to param_ramp_setup() at the end of the low-priority queue
00311 
00312         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00313         #pragma unused(attr)
00314 }
00315 
00316 t_max_err param_attr_getramp(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00317 {
00318         *argc = 1;
00319         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00320                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00321         atom_setsym(*argv, x->attr_ramp);
00322         
00323         jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00324         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00325 }
00326 
00327 
00328 t_max_err param_attr_setrampfunction(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00329 {
00330         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00331         x->attr_rampfunction = arg;
00332 
00333         x->ramper->setFunction(x->attr_rampfunction);
00334 
00335         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00336         #pragma unused(attr)
00337 }
00338

00397 
00398 
00399 t_max_err param_attr_getvalue(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00400 {
00401         *argc = x->list_size;
00402         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00403                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00404         sysmem_copyptr(x->atom_list, *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00405 
00406         jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00407         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00408 }
00409 
00410 
00411 void param_getRampFunctionParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00412 {
00413         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00414         t_atom          *a;
00415         long            ac = 0;
00416         t_atom          *av = NULL;
00417         
00418         if(!argc){
00419                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to getParameter");
00420                 return;
00421         }
00422         
00423         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00424         //obj->function->getParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00425         obj->ramper->getFunctionParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00426         if(ac) {
00427                 //atom_setsym(a+0, parameterName);
00428                 //atom_setfloat(a+1, av);
00429                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom)*(ac+1));
00430                 // Forst list item is name of parameter
00431                 atom_setsym(a, parameterName);
00432                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00433                 sysmem_copyptr(av, a+1, sizeof(t_atom)*ac);
00434                 object_obex_dumpout(obj, gensym("ramp.function.getParameter"), ac+1, av);
00435         
00436                 // The pointer to an atom assign in the getParameter method needs to be freed.
00437                 sysmem_freeptr(av);
00438                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00439         }
00440 }
00441 
00442 
00443 void param_setRampFunctionParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00444 {
00445         //double                value = 0.0;
00446         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00447         
00448         if(argc < 2){
00449                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to setParameter");
00450                 return;
00451         }
00452         
00453         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00454         //obj->function->setParameter(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00455         obj->ramper->setFunctionParameter(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00456 }
00457 
00458 
00459 void param_getRampDriveParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00460 {
00461         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00462         t_atom          a[2];
00463         double          value = 0.0;
00464         
00465         if(!argc){
00466                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to getParameter");
00467                 return;
00468         }
00469         
00470         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00471         
00472         obj->ramper->attrget(parameterName, &value);
00473         atom_setsym(a+0, parameterName);
00474         atom_setfloat(a+1, value);
00475         object_obex_dumpout(obj, gensym("ramp.drive.getParameter"), 2, a);
00476 }
00477 
00478 
00479 void param_setRampDriveParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00480 {
00481         double          value = 0.0;
00482         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00483         
00484         if(argc < 2){
00485                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to setParameter");
00486                 return;
00487         }
00488         
00489         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv+0);
00490         value = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00491         obj->ramper->attrset(parameterName, value);
00492 }

00495 /************************************************************************************/
00496 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00497 #pragma mark -
00498 #pragma mark methods
00499 
00500 // Method for Assistance Messages
00501 void param_assist(t_param *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00502 {
00503         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00504                 strcpy(dst, "input");
00505         else{                                                   // Outlets
00506                 switch(arg){
00507                         case k_outlet_set:
00508                                         strcpy(dst, "set: connect to ui object");
00509                                         break;
00510                         case k_outlet_direct:
00511                                         strcpy(dst, "direct: values");
00512                                         break;
00513                         case k_outlet_dumpout:
00514                                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00515                                         break;
00516                 }
00517         }               
00518 }
00519 
00520 
00521 // DUMP: use for debugging - dump state to the Max window
00522 void param_dump(t_param *x)
00523 {
00524         char    s[256];
00525         t_atom  a[4];
00526         
00527         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00528                 sprintf(s, "%s:clipmode", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00529                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00530                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_clipmode);
00531                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00532 
00533                 sprintf(s, "%s:description", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00534                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00535                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_description);
00536                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00537 
00538                 sprintf(s, "%s:priority", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00539                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00540                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->attr_priority);
00541                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00542 
00543                 sprintf(s, "%s:ramp", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00544                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00545                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->attr_ramp);
00546                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00547 
00548                 sprintf(s, "%s:range", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00549                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00550                 atom_setfloat(&a[1], x->common.attr_range[0]);
00551                 atom_setfloat(&a[2], x->common.attr_range[1]);
00552                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 3, a, NULL);
00553 
00554                 sprintf(s, "%s:repetitions", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00555                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00556                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->common.attr_repetitions);
00557                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00558 
00559                 sprintf(s, "%s:type", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00560                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00561                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_type);
00562                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00563 
00564                 sprintf(s, "%s:ui/freeze", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00565                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00566                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->attr_ui_freeze);
00567                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00568 
00569                 sprintf(s, "%s:value", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00570                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00571                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&a[1], &x->attr_value);
00572                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00573         }
00574 }
00575 
00576 
00577 // 'bang' method for user input
00578 void param_bang(t_param *x)
00579 {
00580 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00581         t_atom  a;
00582         
00583         atom_setsym(&a, gensym(""));
00584         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00585         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, 1, &a);
00586 
00587         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00588         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00589                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&a, &x->name_atom);
00590                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 1, &a, NULL);
00591         }
00592 #else
00593         x->param_output(x);
00594 #endif
00595 }
00596 
00597 
00598 // Actual bang functions
00599 void param_output_generic(void *z)
00600 {
00601         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00602         
00603         if(x->list_size == 1){
00604                 param_clip_generic(x);
00605                 if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_LONG)
00606                         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00607                 else if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_FLOAT)
00608                         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_float);
00609                 else if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_SYM)
00610                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_sym, 0, NULL);
00611         }
00612         else if(x->list_size > 1){
00613                 param_clip_generic(x);
00614                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00615         } 
00616         else{   // zero args
00617                 param_output_none(x);
00618         }
00619         param_send_feedback(x);
00620 }
00621 
00622 
00623 void param_output_int(void *z)
00624 {
00625         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00626 
00627         param_clip_int(x);
00628         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00629         param_send_feedback(x);
00630 }
00631 
00632 
00633 void param_output_float(void *z)
00634 {
00635         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00636 
00637         param_clip_float(x);
00638         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_float);
00639         param_send_feedback(x);
00640 }
00641 
00642 
00643 void param_output_symbol(void *z)
00644 {
00645         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00646 
00647         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_sym, 0, NULL);
00648         param_send_feedback(x);
00649 }
00650 
00651 
00652 void param_output_list(void *z)
00653 {
00654         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00655         
00656         param_clip_list(x);
00657         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00658         param_send_feedback(x);
00659 }
00660 
00661 
00662 void param_output_none(void *z)
00663 {
00664         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00665         t_atom output[1];
00666         t_atom *out = (t_atom *)(&output);
00667 
00668         // bang direct output
00669         outlet_bang(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct]);
00670         
00671         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00672         // We can not use (method)param_send_feedback here as it assumes an additional argument
00673         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00674                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out, &x->name_atom);
00675                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 1, out, NULL);
00676         }
00677 }
00678 
00679 
00680 // INC & DEC
00681 void param_inc(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00682 {
00683         float   stepmult = 1.0;
00684         long    ramptime = 0;           // ms
00685         t_atom  a[3];                           // value, 'ramp', value
00686         short   a_len = 1;
00687         
00688         // Check for slave mode
00689         if(x->attr_slavemode) {
00690                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], ps_inc, 0, NULL);
00691                 return;
00692         }
00693         
00694         // Check for Arguments...
00695         if(argc){
00696                 // Look for arg to specify the number of steps to move
00697                 if(argv->a_type == A_FLOAT){
00698                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_float;
00699                         argc--;
00700                         argv++;
00701                 }
00702                 else if(argv->a_type == A_LONG){
00703                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_long;
00704                         argc--;
00705                         argv++;
00706                 }
00707                 
00708                 // Look for args to specify a ramp time
00709                 if(argc){
00710                         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00711                                 if(argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp){
00712                                         argc--;
00713                                         argv++;
00714                                         if(argc){
00715                                                 ramptime = atom_getlong(argv);
00716                                                 if(ramptime){
00717                                                         atom_setsym(a+1, ps_ramp);
00718                                                         atom_setlong(a+2, ramptime);
00719                                                         a_len = 3;
00720                                                 }
00721                                         }
00722                                 }
00723                         }
00724                 }
00725         }
00726         
00727         if(x->ramper)
00728                 x->ramper->stop();
00729                 
00730         if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int)
00731                 atom_setlong(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_long + (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00732         else if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
00733                 atom_setfloat(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_float + (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00734         else if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle){
00735                 if(x->attr_value.a_w.w_long == 1)
00736                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 0;
00737                 else
00738                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 1;
00739                 param_output_int(x);
00740                 return;
00741         }
00742         else{
00743                 error("%s parameter (in the %s module) is an inappropriate type for the 'inc' message.");
00744                 return;
00745         }
00746 
00747         param_dispatched(x, msg, a_len, a);
00748 }
00749 
00750 
00751 void param_dec(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00752 {
00753         float   stepmult = 1.0;
00754         long    ramptime = 0;           // ms
00755         t_atom  a[3];                           // value, 'ramp', value
00756         short   a_len = 1;
00757 
00758         // Check for slave mode
00759         if(x->attr_slavemode) {
00760                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], ps_dec, 0, NULL);
00761                 return;
00762         }
00763         
00764         // Check for Arguments...
00765         if(argc){
00766                 // Look for arg to specify the number of steps to move
00767                 if(argv->a_type == A_FLOAT){
00768                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_float;
00769                         argc--;
00770                         argv++;
00771                 }
00772                 else if(argv->a_type == A_LONG){
00773                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_long;
00774                         argc--;
00775                         argv++;
00776                 }
00777                 
00778                 // Look for args to specify a ramp time
00779                 if(argc){
00780                         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00781                                 if(argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp){
00782                                         argc--;
00783                                         argv++;
00784                                         if(argc){
00785                                                 ramptime = atom_getlong(argv);
00786                                                 if(ramptime){
00787                                                         atom_setsym(a+1, ps_ramp);
00788                                                         atom_setlong(a+2, ramptime);
00789                                                         a_len = 3;
00790                                                 }
00791                                         }
00792                                 }
00793                         }
00794                 }
00795         }
00796 
00797         // new input - halt any ramping...
00798         if(x->ramper)
00799                 x->ramper->stop();
00800                 
00801         if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int)
00802                 atom_setlong(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_long - (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00803         else if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
00804                 atom_setfloat(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_float - (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00805         else if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle){
00806                 if(x->attr_value.a_w.w_long == 1)
00807                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 0;
00808                 else
00809                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 1;
00810                 param_output_int(x);
00811                 return;
00812         }
00813         else{
00814                 error("%s parameter (in the %s module) is an inappropriate type for the 'dec' message.");
00815                 return;
00816         }
00817 
00818         param_dispatched(x, msg, a_len, a);
00819 }
00820 
00821 
00822 // INT INPUT
00823 void param_int(t_param *x, long value)
00824 {
00825         // Check for slave mode
00826         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00827                 outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], value);
00828                 return;
00829         }
00830         x->list_size = 1;
00831         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00832                 if(value == atom_getlong(&x->attr_value))
00833                         return;
00834         }
00835         // new input - halt any ramping...
00836         if(x->ramper)
00837                 x->ramper->stop();
00838         atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, value);
00839         x->param_output(x);
00840 }
00841 
00842 
00843 // FLOAT INPUT
00844 void param_float(t_param *x, double value)
00845 {
00846         // Check for slave mode
00847         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00848                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], value);
00849                 return;
00850         }
00851         
00852         x->list_size = 1;
00853         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00854                 if(value == atom_getfloat(&x->attr_value))
00855                         return;
00856         }
00857         // new input - halt any ramping...
00858         if(x->ramper)
00859                 x->ramper->stop();
00860 
00861         atom_setfloat(&x->attr_value, value);
00862         x->param_output(x);
00863 }
00864 
00865 
00866 // SYMBOL INPUT
00867 void param_symbol(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00868 {
00869         // Check for slave mode
00870         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00871                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], msg, argc, argv);
00872                 return;
00873         }
00874         
00875         x->list_size = 1;
00876         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00877                 if(jcom_core_atom_compare(x->common.attr_type, &x->attr_value, argv))
00878                         return;
00879         }
00880         atom_setsym(&x->attr_value, msg);
00881         x->param_output(x);
00882 
00883 }
00884 
00885 
00886 void param_ui_refresh(t_param *x)
00887 {
00888         if (!x->attr_slavemode)
00889                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, x->list_size, &x->attr_value);
00890 }
00891 
00892 
00893 // Send feedback to the hub
00894 void param_send_feedback(t_param *x)
00895 {
00896         t_atom output[LISTSIZE + 1];
00897         t_atom *out = (t_atom *)(&output);
00898         
00899         // send to our ui outlet
00900         if(x->attr_ui_freeze == 0)
00901                 qelem_set(x->ui_qelem);
00902         
00903         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00904         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00905                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out, &x->name_atom);
00906                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out+1, &x->attr_value);
00907                 // copy any remaining atoms
00908                 if(x->list_size > 1) 
00909                         sysmem_copyptr(&x->atom_list[1], out + 2, sizeof(t_atom) * (x->list_size - 1));
00910                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, x->list_size + 1, out, NULL);
00911         }
00912         // notify pattr that we have modified data
00913 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00914         object_notify(x, _sym_modified, NULL);
00915 #endif
00916 }
00917 
00918 
00919 // Send values to a potentially connected ui object at the first outlet
00920 void param_ui_queuefn(t_param *x)
00921 {
00922         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, x->list_size, &x->attr_value);
00923 }
00924 
00925 
00926 // messages received from jcom.hub
00927 void param_dispatched(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00928 {
00929         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00930                 if (argc==0)
00931                         outlet_bang(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct]);
00932                 else if (argc==1) {             
00933                         switch(argv[0].a_type) 
00934                                 {
00935                                         case A_LONG:
00936                                                 outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getlong(argv));
00937                                                 break;
00938                                         case A_FLOAT:
00939                                                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getfloat(argv));
00940                                                 break;
00941                                         case A_SYM:
00942                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getsym(argv), 0, 0L);
00943                                                 break;
00944                                         default:
00945                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], msg, argc, argv);
00946                                                 break;
00947                                 }
00948                 }
00949                 else
00950                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, argc, argv);
00951         }
00952         else {
00953                         // new input - halt any ramping...
00954                         if(x->ramper)
00955                                 x->ramper->stop();
00956                 
00957                         if(argc == 1 ){
00958                                 // If repetitions are disabled, we check for a repetition by treating
00959                                 // this as a 1 element list
00960                                 if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0 && param_list_compare(x->atom_list, 
00961                                         x->list_size, argv, argc)) 
00962                                         return;
00963 
00964                                 x->list_size = 1;                               
00965                                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->attr_value, argv);
00966                                 x->param_output(x);
00967                         } else if(argc > 1) {
00968                                 param_list(x, msg, argc, argv);
00969                         }
00970                         else {  // no args
00971 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00972                                 // generic parameters may have no arg -- i.e. to open a dialog that defines the arg
00973                                 if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic)
00974                                         x->list_size = 0;
00975 #endif                  
00976                                 x->param_output(x);
00977                         }
00978                 }
00979 }
00980 
00981 // Returns true if lists are identical
00982 int param_list_compare(t_atom *x, long lengthx, t_atom *y, long lengthy)
00983 {
00984         // If lists differ in length they're obviously not the same
00985         if(lengthx == lengthy) {
00986                 short type;
00987                 for(int i = 0; i < lengthx; i++) {
00988                         if((x->a_type) != (y->a_type))
00989                                 return 0; // not identical, types differ
00990                         
00991                         type = x->a_type;
00992                         if((type == A_FLOAT) && (x->a_w.w_float != y->a_w.w_float))
00993                                 return 0;
00994                         else if((type == A_LONG) && (x->a_w.w_long != y->a_w.w_long))
00995                                 return 0;
00996                         else if((type == A_SYM) && (x->a_w.w_sym != y->a_w.w_sym))
00997                                 return 0;
00998                         
00999                         x++; y++;  // keep going
01000                 }
01001         } 
01002         else {
01003                 return 0; // list lengths differ
01004         }
01005         
01006         return 1;
01007 }
01008 
01009 // LIST INPUT <value, ramptime>
01010 void param_list(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
01011 {
01012         double  start[LISTSIZE], values[LISTSIZE], time;
01013         int i;
01014         
01015         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
01016                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, argc, argv);
01017                 return;
01018         }
01019                 
01020         // Check the second to last item in the list first, which when ramping should == the string ramp
01021         t_atom* ramp = argv + (argc - 2);
01022         if (ramp->a_type == A_SYM && ramp->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp) {
01023 
01024                 time = atom_getfloat(argv+(argc-1));
01025 
01026                 // Only one list member if @type is msg_int of msg_float
01027                 if ( x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int || x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float)
01028                         argc = 1;
01029                 else
01030                         argc = argc - 2;
01031                 
01032                 for (i=0; i<argc; i++) {
01033                         values[i] = atom_getfloat(argv+i);
01034                         if (i<=x->list_size)
01035                                 start[i] = atom_getfloat(&x->atom_list[i]);
01036                         else
01037                                 start[i] = atom_getfloat(&x->atom_list[(x->list_size)-1]);
01038                 }
01039 
01040                 if(time <= 0){
01041                         jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->attr_value, argv);
01042                         x->param_output(x);
01043                         return;
01044                 }       
01045 
01046                 if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
01047                         if(param_list_compare(x->atom_list, x->list_size, argv, argc))
01048                                 return; // nothing to do
01049                 }
01050 
01051                 x->list_size = argc;
01052                 x->ramper->set(argc, start);
01053                 x->ramper->go(argc, values, time);
01054         } 
01055         else {
01056                 // Don't output if the input data is identical
01057                 if(!x->common.attr_repetitions) {
01058                         if(param_list_compare(x->atom_list, x->list_size, argv, argc))
01059                                 return; // nothing to do
01060                 }
01061                 
01062                 // Avoid copying more than one atom if the type only can have one argument
01063                 if(x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_list && x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_generic
01064                         && x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_none) {
01065                         // If attr_type is != to anyone of the above values then we know 
01066                         // that it must be == to a scalar type.  This ensures it will behave
01067                         // as a scalar and not a list.
01068                         argc = 1;
01069                 }
01070                         
01071                 for(i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
01072                         switch(argv[i].a_type) 
01073                         {
01074                                 case A_LONG:
01075                                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getlong(argv + i));
01076                                         break;
01077                                 case A_FLOAT:
01078                                         atom_setfloat(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getfloat(argv + i));
01079                                         break;
01080                                 case A_SYM:
01081                                         atom_setsym(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getsym(argv + i));
01082                                         break;
01083                                 default:
01084                                         error("param_list: no type specification");
01085                                         break;
01086                         }
01087                 }
01088                 x->list_size = argc;
01089                 x->param_output(x);
01090         }
01091 }
01092 
01093 
01094 #pragma mark -
01095 #pragma mark Ramp Units
01096 
01097 void param_ramp_callback_float(void *v, short, double *value)
01098 {
01099         t_param *x = (t_param *)v;
01100         float   oldval = atom_getfloat(&x->attr_value);
01101         
01102         if(x->common.attr_repetitions || *value != oldval){
01103                 atom_setfloat(&x->attr_value, *value);
01104                 param_output_float(x);
01105         }
01106 }
01107 
01108 
01109 void param_ramp_callback_int(void *v, short, double *value)
01110 {
01111         t_param *x= (t_param *)v;
01112         long    val     = *value;
01113         long    oldval;
01114 
01115         oldval = atom_getlong(&x->attr_value);
01116         if (x->common.attr_repetitions || val != oldval){
01117                 atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, val);
01118                 param_output_int(x);
01119         }
01120 }
01121 
01122 
01123 void param_ramp_callback_list(void *v, short argc, double *value)
01124 {
01125         long i;
01126         t_param *x = (t_param *)v;
01127         
01128         // we won't bother about avoiding repetitions for list, so never mind oldval
01129 
01130         for (i=0; i<argc; i++)
01131                 atom_setfloat(&x->atom_list[i], value[i]);
01132         param_output_list(x);   
01133 }
01134 
01135 
01136 void param_ramp_setup(t_param *x)
01137 {
01138         // 1. destroy the old rampunit
01139         if(x->ramper != NULL)
01140                 delete x->ramper;
01141                 
01142         // 2. create the new rampunit
01143         // For backwards compatibility, we still accept 'linear' as an input value for @ramp
01144         // but we need to convert that to the actual name of the rampunit...
01145         if(x->attr_ramp == ps_linear || x->attr_ramp == gensym("linear.sched"))
01146                 x->attr_ramp = gensym("scheduler");
01147 
01148         // For some types ramping doesn't make sense, so they will be set to none
01149         if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_none) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_symbol) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
01150                 x->attr_ramp = gensym("none");
01151                 
01152         if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle))
01153                 x->ramper = new rampunit(x->attr_ramp->s_name, param_ramp_callback_int, (void *)x);
01154         else if (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_list)
01155                 x->ramper = new rampunit(x->attr_ramp->s_name, param_ramp_callback_list, (void *)x);
01156         else
01157                 x->ramper = new rampunit(x->attr_ramp->s_name, param_ramp_callback_float, (void *)x);
01158 
01159         if(x->ramper == NULL)
01160                 error("jcom.parameter (%s module): could not allocate memory for ramp unit!", x->common.module_name);
01161 }
